x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Share the complete conversation if someone approaches you about a misleading excerpt.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Be aware of what you put in writing
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Not because you're doing anything wrong, but because anything can be stripped of context.

objects.name: Sextortion
objects.description: Threatening to release intimate content (real or fabricated) unless victim complies with demands for money, further intimate content, sexual acts, or other concessions. Combines elements of sexual exploitation, financial fraud, and psychological coercion, creating a cycle of escalating demands.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone threatens to share intimate content unless you send money, more intimate content, or comply with other demands. This can happen with real images or fabricated content.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Don't pay or comply with demands. Payment doesn't stop the threats — it usually leads to more demands. Report to police immediately.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Someone threatens to share intimate content unless you comply
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Demands for money, more images, or other actions.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Escalating demands after initial compliance
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Giving in leads to more demands, not an end to the threats.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Don't pay or send more content
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Complying with demands almost never stops the threats.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to police immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Sextortion is a serious criminal offence.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to the eSafety Commissioner
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: eSafety can help with removal if images are shared.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Block the person but save all evidence first
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Screenshot every threat, demand, and account detail before blocking.

objects.name: Catfishing/Romance Fraud
objects.description: Creating a false online identity to build a fraudulent romantic relationship with victim for purposes of financial exploitation, emotional manipulation, intelligence gathering, or other harm. May involve elaborate fake personas maintained over months or years, including stolen photos, fabricated life stories, and manufactured emotional bonds.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone creates a fake online identity to form a romantic connection with you — using stolen photos and fabricated stories to build trust before exploiting it for money, information, or control.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you've sent money, contact your bank immediately. There's no shame in being deceived — these operations are sophisticated and target everyone.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The person always has excuses for not meeting in person or video calling
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They avoid any form of verification that would reveal their real identity.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The relationship moves unusually fast emotionally
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Declarations of love, plans for the future, and emotional intensity develop very quickly.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Requests for money, gift cards, or financial help
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: A 'crisis' emerges that requires your financial help.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Reverse image search their photos
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Use Google Images or TinEye to check if their photos appear elsewhere online under different names.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Never send money to someone you haven't met in person
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Legitimate romantic interests don't need emergency funds from people they've never met.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to the platform and to Scamwatch
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Report at scamwatch.gov.au.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your bank if you've sent money
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They may be able to recover or stop transfers.

objects.name: Reputation Destruction SEO
objects.description: Creating websites, blog posts, social media content, or other material specifically designed to rank highly in search results for victim's name, damaging their reputation to anyone who searches for them. Content may include false accusations, embarrassing information, intimate images, or misleading narratives.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Destroying Your Reputation in Search Results
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone creates websites, posts, or content specifically designed to appear in search results for your name — filling the first page of Google with damaging, false, or embarrassing content about you.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Searching your name returns harmful content you didn't create
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Negative posts, fake profiles, or defamatory content ranks in search results.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: New websites or pages about you appear that you didn't make
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Deliberately created content designed to damage your reputation.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Document all harmful search results
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Screenshot and save URLs of content that appears in search results for your name.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Request removal from Google
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Google has a process for removing certain types of harmful personal information from search results.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Consider professional reputation management
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: SEO specialists can help push harmful content lower in search results.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report defamatory content to hosting platforms
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Request removal of false and harmful content.

objects.name: Historical Content Weaponization
objects.description: Surfacing old posts, photos, messages, or other historical digital content to harm victim in their current context. Includes finding embarrassing teenage posts, old dating profiles, past political statements, or previously private content that can be taken out of context to damage victim's current relationships, employment, or reputation.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Digging Up Old Content to Use Against You
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone searches through your digital history — old social media posts, archived content, or past online activity — to find things that can be used to embarrass, discredit, or blackmail you.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Old posts or content you'd forgotten about resurface
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Things from years ago are suddenly being shared or referenced.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person references content from deep in your history
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They've clearly spent time searching through your past.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Review and clean up old social media posts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Most platforms let you delete or hide old posts. Consider a privacy review of your history.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check what's visible on web archives
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Sites like the Wayback Machine may have cached old content.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Adjust privacy settings on past content
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Many platforms allow you to change the audience on old posts retroactively.

objects.name: Fake Evidence Creation
objects.description: Fabricating digital evidence including fake emails, text messages, documents, receipts, screenshots, or records to frame victim for misconduct, support false legal claims, or manipulate decision-makers. May involve sophisticated forgeries using editing tools or simple fabrication of documents.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone fabricates digital evidence — fake messages, edited screenshots, forged documents, or manipulated records — to use against you in legal proceedings, custody disputes, or to manipulate others.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you suspect fake evidence is being used against you in legal proceedings, tell your lawyer immediately. Digital forensics can often prove fabrication.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Evidence presented against you doesn't match your records
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Screenshots, messages, or documents that don't match what actually happened.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The timing, formatting, or details of 'evidence' seem off
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Metadata, fonts, or platform formatting don't look right.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Keep your own independent records of all important interactions
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Your records are your protection against fabrication.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Tell your lawyer about suspected fake evidence immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Legal professionals can engage digital forensics experts to examine evidence.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Don't accuse the other person of fabrication without evidence
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Let the forensic evidence speak for itself in legal settings.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Preserve originals of all communications
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Export full conversation logs rather than relying on screenshots.

objects.name: Communication Interception & Response
objects.description: Reading and responding to victim's messages while impersonating the victim, without their knowledge. Perpetrator intercepts communications from victim's friends, family, support services, or legal representatives and responds as the victim, undermining support networks and controlling information flow.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Message logs showing responses victim didn't send
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Reading & Replying to Your Messages as You
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone reads your messages from friends, family, or support services — and responds pretending to be you, without your knowledge. This isolates you by undermining your relationships and cutting off support.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If someone is intercepting your messages, people trying to help you may be receiving false responses. Consider reaching out through a completely different channel.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Friends or family mention conversations you don't remember having
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: People reference messages 'you' sent that you didn't write.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Support services or lawyers say you declined help or cancelled appointments
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Someone responded on your behalf to turn away support.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Relationships deteriorate for reasons you can't understand
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: People seem hurt or confused by interactions that didn't happen from your side.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Tell trusted people about the interception
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Explain that messages from your accounts may not be from you. Establish a verification method.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Use a separate, secure communication channel
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A new phone, a new email, or an in-person visit to re-establish contact with key people.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check your accounts for unauthorised access
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Review active sessions and change passwords from a safe device.

objects.name: Contact Blocking/Filtering
objects.description: Blocking victim's contacts or filtering their incoming communications without victim's knowledge or consent. Perpetrator may block specific people on victim's phone, set up email filters to auto-delete messages from support contacts, or manipulate device settings to prevent certain calls or messages from reaching victim.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Blocking Your Contacts Without Your Knowledge
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone blocks phone numbers, email addresses, or social media connections on your devices — so messages from friends, family, or services never reach you, and you don't know they tried.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: People say they tried to contact you but you never received the messages
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Friends, family, or services report messages and calls going unanswered.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You feel increasingly isolated without understanding why
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: People seem to have stopped reaching out, but they actually haven't.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Blocked contact lists on your phone contain numbers you didn't block
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Check your device's blocked contacts list for unexpected entries.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Regularly check your blocked contacts and email filters
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: On iPhone: Settings > Phone > Blocked Contacts. Check email spam/filter rules too.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Ask trusted people to test whether their messages reach you
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A simple 'did you get my text?' check can reveal blocking.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Use a secondary contact method for critical relationships
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Give key people an alternate way to reach you if your primary phone seems unreliable.

objects.name: Social Media Control
objects.description: Controlling who victim can follow, friend, interact with, or be visible to on social media platforms. May involve demanding victim unfriend specific contacts, monitoring follower/following lists, requiring approval before posting, or demanding social media passwords to vet all interactions.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone controls who you can follow, what you can post, or who can contact you on social media — either by demanding you change settings, by accessing your accounts, or through constant monitoring that makes you self-censor.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You feel you can't post freely because the other person will react
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Fear of the other person's response controls what you share online.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person dictates who you can follow or be friends with online
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They demand you remove connections or restrict your social media activity.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your social media settings have been changed without your input
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Privacy settings, friend lists, or profile information has been altered.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Recognise that controlling your social media is controlling behaviour
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: You have the right to use social media freely.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Create a private account the other person doesn't know about
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A separate space where you can communicate freely.
x_tfa_public_actions.safety_note: Use a different email and don't link it to your primary accounts.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Talk to someone you trust about what's happening
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Controlling behaviour escalates. Getting support early matters.

objects.name: Device Time/Access Restrictions
objects.description: Using parental controls, screen time management, MDM features, or physical control to restrict when and how victim can use their own devices. Limits victim's ability to communicate, access information, seek help, or maintain independence.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone controls when and how you can use your phone, computer, or internet — imposing time limits, taking your devices, or restricting your access to technology.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Controlling someone's access to communication technology is a form of coercive control. In Australia, this can be a criminal offence.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person takes your phone or controls when you can use it
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Your access to devices is rationed or conditional.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Parental control software is installed on your devices (when you're an adult)
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Screen time limits or content restrictions are applied to your devices without your consent.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Internet access is turned off as punishment or control
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Wi-Fi passwords are changed, routers are unplugged, or data is restricted.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Identify a safe communication method the other person can't control
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A device at work, a trusted friend's phone, or a library computer.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Remove parental control profiles from your devices
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: These should not be on an adult's device without their consent.
x_tfa_public_actions.safety_note: The other person may be notified.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Talk to a support service
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Call 1800RESPECT (1800 737 732) from a safe phone. Controlling access to technology is recognised as abuse.

objects.name: Network Poisoning
objects.description: Contacting victim's support network (friends, family, colleagues, therapist, legal counsel) to spread lies, create conflict, or undermine trust. Perpetrator strategically reaches out to key support people to isolate victim from help sources, often preemptively positioning themselves as the reasonable party.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Messages from perpetrator to support contacts
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone contacts your friends, family, colleagues, or community to spread lies about you — turning your support network against you so you have nowhere to turn.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: People in your life are distancing themselves based on false information
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Relationships change because of things the other person has told them.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person contacts your friends, family, or workplace
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They reach out to people in your life under various pretexts.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your reputation within your community shifts without explanation
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: People treat you differently based on a narrative you didn't create.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Talk directly to the people who matter
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Have honest conversations with close friends and family about what's happening.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Keep records of what the other person tells people
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: If you learn about specific lies, document them.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Don't try to counter every lie
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Focus on your closest relationships. You can't control everyone's perception.

objects.name: Platform Banning Coordination
objects.description: Orchestrating victim's removal or banning from online platforms, groups, or communities where they have established support networks. Uses coordinated mass reporting, false claims of terms of service violations, or manipulation of community moderators to silence and isolate victim.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone coordinates false reports to get your accounts suspended or banned from platforms you rely on — for work, social connection, or accessing services.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your accounts are suspended for violations you didn't commit
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Bans or restrictions appear after waves of false reports.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Multiple platform bans happen in a short period
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Coordinated reporting across platforms.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Appeal every suspension
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Platforms have appeal processes. Use them and explain the pattern of false reporting.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Document the pattern across platforms
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Evidence of coordinated false reporting strengthens your case.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact platform trust and safety teams directly
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Explain the situation and request protection for your accounts.

objects.name: Communication Monitoring Disclosure
objects.description: Deliberately telling victim that all their communications are being monitored to create a chilling effect of self-censorship. Victim becomes afraid to reach out for help, discuss the abuse, or communicate honestly, effectively isolating themselves out of fear. May be truthful or bluffed.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Records of perpetrator demonstrating monitoring knowledge
Communication records showing disclosure of monitoring
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone tells you they're monitoring everything you say and do online — creating a chilling effect where you're afraid to reach out for help, talk to friends, or communicate freely.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Even if the monitoring claims are exaggerated or false, the fear they create is real. Reach out for help through a channel you believe is safe.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person explicitly tells you they can see everything
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Statements like 'I know everything you do' or 'I can read all your messages'.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You self-censor everything because you assume you're watched
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Fear of surveillance prevents you from seeking help.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person demonstrates knowledge that seems to prove monitoring
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They may have some access, but use it to imply total surveillance.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Understand that total monitoring is very difficult
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Most people can't actually see everything. The claim is often bigger than the reality.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Find one safe way to communicate
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Even one unmonitored channel — a friend's phone, an in-person conversation — is enough to start getting help.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact 1800RESPECT from a safe phone
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They can help you assess how much monitoring is actually happening and make a safety plan.

objects.name: Support Resource Blocking
objects.description: Blocking victim's access to helplines, support websites, crisis services, legal aid resources, or domestic violence organizations. May involve website blocking through router controls, removing helpline numbers from victim's phone, or intercepting communications with support services.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Browser history showing blocked access attempts
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Blocking Your Access to Help Services
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone blocks your access to support services — helpline numbers, support websites, counselling services, or legal aid — so you can't get help.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If someone is blocking your access to support services, that is a serious form of coercive control. Find any way you can to reach help.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Helpline numbers or support websites don't work from your devices
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Numbers may be blocked, or websites may be filtered.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person discourages you from seeking help
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They tell you services won't help, or that calling will make things worse.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Contact details for services have been deleted from your phone
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Saved numbers or bookmarks for support services disappear.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Memorise key numbers: 1800RESPECT (1800 737 732), 000 for emergencies
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Numbers you know by heart can't be deleted from your phone.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Access support from a different device or location
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A library, a friend's phone, or your workplace.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Ask someone you trust to make the call for you
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: If you can't safely call, someone else can.

objects.name: Identity Document Control
objects.description: Controlling access to digital copies of victim's important identification documents including passport scans, birth certificates, tax records, medical records, immigration documents, or legal paperwork. Restricts victim's ability to access services, prove identity, or leave the relationship.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Evidence of document deletion or transfer
Victim testimony about document requests denied
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone takes control of your digital identity documents — passwords, Medicare, tax accounts, licences — making it difficult to access services, travel, or prove your identity.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Loss of identity documents can make it very difficult to access services or leave an unsafe situation. Government agencies can help you recover access.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You can't access your myGov, tax, Medicare, or other government accounts
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Passwords have been changed or your accounts have been linked to the other person's.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person holds all the important account credentials
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You don't know the passwords to your own identity-related accounts.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your mail is being redirected or intercepted
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Important documents and correspondence aren't reaching you.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact Services Australia to regain access to myGov
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They can verify your identity and help you recover your account.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Visit a government service centre in person with photo ID
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: In-person identity verification can bypass compromised online accounts.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Set up a PO Box or redirect mail to a safe address
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Ensure important documents reach you.

objects.name: Email/Communication Rerouting
objects.description: Setting up email forwarding rules, message redirects, or call forwarding to intercept victim's incoming communications without their knowledge. Allows perpetrator to monitor all communications and selectively prevent messages from reaching victim, particularly from support services or legal representatives.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Email rule audit showing unauthorized forwarding
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone sets up forwarding rules on your email or messaging accounts so copies of everything you receive are also sent to them — or so that certain messages are redirected and never reach you.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You're not receiving messages or emails you're expecting
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: People tell you they sent things you never received.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Email forwarding or filtering rules you didn't create
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Check your email settings for unexpected forwarding addresses or filter rules.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person knows about emails or messages you received
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They reference content from messages sent to you.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check email forwarding and filter rules immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Gmail: Settings > Forwarding. Also check Filters and Blocked Addresses.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check app-specific forwarding
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: WhatsApp Web, Telegram sessions, and other apps may have active sessions forwarding your messages.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Change email passwords and review all connected apps
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Remove any third-party app access you don't recognise.

objects.name: Financial Account Lockout
objects.description: Changing passwords, removing authorized users, or otherwise denying victim access to shared or individual financial accounts. Cuts victim off from their own money, savings, investments, or financial records, creating immediate economic vulnerability and dependence.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Bank correspondence about authorized user changes
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Locking You Out of Your Money
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone locks you out of bank accounts, credit cards, or financial services — changing passwords, removing your access, or freezing accounts you depend on.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you've been locked out of your bank accounts, contact your bank directly. Financial abuse is taken seriously by financial institutions.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You can't access online banking or financial accounts
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Passwords have been changed or your access has been revoked.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Cards are cancelled or frozen without your knowledge
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Your cards stop working unexpectedly.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person controls all financial account access
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You have no independent access to money.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your bank directly, in person or by phone
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Explain the situation. Banks have processes for domestic and family violence situations.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Open an account in your name only
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A separate account the other person doesn't know about provides financial safety.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Ask about the bank's DFV support services
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Most Australian banks have dedicated domestic and family violence teams.

objects.name: Transaction Monitoring
objects.description: Tracking all of victim's financial transactions through shared bank account access, transaction alert notifications, statement monitoring, or financial app access. Creates comprehensive surveillance of victim's spending, location (from merchant addresses), social activities, and any attempts to prepare for leaving.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Evidence of perpetrator referencing specific transactions
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone monitors every transaction you make — tracking where you shop, what you buy, and how you spend money through shared bank accounts, linked cards, or transaction notifications.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person questions purchases they shouldn't know about
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They reference specific transactions from your account.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You feel unable to make any purchase without scrutiny
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Every dollar is monitored and questioned.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Transaction notifications are going to the other person's device
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Alerts for your spending are being received by them.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Open a separate account for independent spending
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Even small amounts of independent money provide freedom.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check notification settings on banking apps
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Remove the other person's device from transaction alerts.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Use cash for sensitive purchases when safe to do so
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Cash transactions don't create digital records.

objects.name: Spending Restrictions
objects.description: Using account controls, card limits, transaction blocks, or approval requirements to restrict what victim can spend money on, how much, and where. May exploit joint account features, parental controls on youth accounts applied to adults, or business account administrative features.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses technology to restrict your spending — setting limits on cards, requiring approval for purchases, or controlling access to money through banking apps.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your card is declined for purchases you should be able to make
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Spending limits have been set without your agreement.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You need to request or justify every purchase
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The other person requires approval before you can spend.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Restrictions change based on the other person's mood or as punishment
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Your access to money is used as a tool of control.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your bank about your rights to your own accounts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: You have legal rights to accounts in your name.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Build independent financial access gradually
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A separate account, even with small amounts, creates options.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Seek financial counselling
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Free financial counselling services can help you plan for financial independence.

objects.name: Unauthorized Transactions
objects.description: Making purchases, transfers, or withdrawals from victim's financial accounts without consent. May drain savings, make extravagant purchases, transfer funds to perpetrator-controlled accounts, or take on debt in victim's name. Often escalates during separation when perpetrator seeks to deplete shared resources.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone makes purchases, transfers, or financial transactions using your accounts or cards without your knowledge or consent.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Unexplained transactions on your accounts
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Purchases, transfers, or withdrawals you didn't make.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your account balance is lower than expected
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Money is leaving your account without your knowledge.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Subscriptions or payments set up without your consent
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Recurring charges you didn't authorise.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report unauthorised transactions to your bank immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Banks can reverse fraudulent transactions and secure your account.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Change your banking passwords and PINs
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Do this from a safe device.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Request new cards with new numbers
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This stops any saved card details from being reused.

objects.name: Coerced Transactions
objects.description: Using threats, intimidation, or manipulation to force victim to transfer money, sign financial documents, take on debt, or make purchases. Digital coercion may include threatening messages, threatening to share intimate images, threatening custody action, or other leverage to compel financial compliance.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Forcing You to Make Financial Decisions
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses threats, pressure, or manipulation to force you to sign contracts, take out loans, transfer money, or make financial decisions that benefit them and harm you.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Coerced financial transactions may be voidable under law. Talk to a lawyer — many legal aid services offer free advice.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You've been pressured into signing documents or making transfers
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Financial decisions made under duress or threat.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Debts or loans in your name that primarily benefit the other person
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You're legally responsible for obligations that serve them.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Seek legal advice about coerced transactions
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Legal aid services can advise on whether transactions can be reversed.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your bank and explain the coercion
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Banks have processes for domestic and family violence situations.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Keep evidence of the pressure or threats
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Messages, recordings, or witness statements documenting the coercion.

objects.name: Crypto/Investment Fraud
objects.description: Deceiving victim into fraudulent cryptocurrency investments, fake trading platforms, or other financial schemes. Often involves building trust, demonstrating fake returns, and gradually escalating investment amounts. May also involve coerced cryptocurrency transfers that are difficult to trace or recover.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone manipulates you into investing money in fake cryptocurrency schemes, fraudulent investments, or scam platforms — often through a romantic relationship or trusted connection.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you've invested money in a scheme you now suspect is fraudulent, contact your bank and report to Scamwatch immediately.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Investment 'returns' exist only on screen, not as withdrawable money
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You can see profits on a platform but can't actually withdraw them.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Pressure to invest more, especially after initial 'gains'
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The scheme requires increasing investment.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person is unusually knowledgeable about your investment decisions
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They guide you to specific platforms or trades.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Stop investing immediately if you suspect fraud
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Don't send more money to recover losses.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to Scamwatch at scamwatch.gov.au
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Report the scheme to help protect others.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your bank about recovering funds
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Quick action may help recover some money.

objects.name: Benefits/Payments Interception
objects.description: Redirecting victim's income, government benefits, tax refunds, insurance payments, or other financial entitlements to perpetrator-controlled accounts. May involve changing direct deposit information, intercepting physical mail, controlling online government portals, or filing fraudulent claims.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone intercepts, redirects, or controls your government payments — including Centrelink, child support, or other benefits — by changing account details or controlling your myGov access.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If your government payments are being intercepted, contact Services Australia directly.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Centrelink or other payments aren't arriving in your account
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Payments have been redirected to a different bank account.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person controls your myGov or Centrelink access
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You can't log in to manage your own payments.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact Services Australia directly
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Visit in person or call. They can verify your identity and restore your access.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Request payments go to an account only you control
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Open a new bank account if needed.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Ask about a social worker at Centrelink
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They can provide additional support for domestic violence situations.

objects.name: Credit/Identity Theft
objects.description: Opening financial accounts, taking on debt, applying for credit, or conducting financial transactions using victim's personal information and identity without consent. Damages victim's credit score, creates legal liability, and may take years to resolve. Often not discovered until victim is denied credit or contacted by collectors.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses your personal information to open accounts, take out loans, or incur debts in your name — damaging your credit history and creating financial obligations you didn't agree to.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Bills or statements arrive for accounts you didn't open
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Credit cards, loans, or services in your name that you didn't apply for.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your credit score has dropped unexpectedly
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Debts you didn't incur are affecting your credit.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Debt collectors contact you about debts you don't recognise
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Obligations in your name that aren't yours.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check your credit report
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: You can get a free credit report from Equifax, Experian, or illion.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report identity theft to IDCARE (1800 595 160)
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: IDCARE is Australia's national identity and cyber support service.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Place a ban on your credit file
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This prevents new credit from being opened in your name.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to police
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Identity theft and fraud are criminal offences.

objects.name: Smart Home Resource Control
objects.description: Controlling heating, cooling, electricity, water, locks, lighting, or other utilities through smart home systems to coerce, punish, or make the home environment hostile. Perpetrator with administrative access can remotely control living conditions, creating physical discomfort or danger.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Controlling Your Home Through Smart Devices
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses smart home technology to control your living environment — changing heating/cooling, locking/unlocking doors, turning utilities on and off, or creating an uncomfortable or unsafe home.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If smart home devices are being used to create unsafe conditions (extreme temperatures, locked doors), contact police.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Temperature, lighting, or appliances change without your input
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The heating turns off in winter, or lights turn on and off at night.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Smart locks change codes or lock you in/out
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You can't get in or out of your home, or the codes keep changing.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person controls these devices remotely after separation
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They retain admin access to home systems after moving out.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Identify who controls the smart home accounts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Determine which devices are connected and who has admin access.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Factory reset smart home devices
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This removes all previous connections. Set them up fresh.
x_tfa_public_actions.safety_note: The other person may notice devices going offline.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your utility providers to separate accounts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Ensure you have independent control of electricity, gas, and internet.

objects.name: Employment Sabotage
objects.description: Interfering with victim's employment through manipulation of work communications, sending messages to employers, sabotaging job applications, damaging professional online presence, or disrupting work-related accounts. Aims to undermine victim's economic independence and professional reputation.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses technology to undermine your employment — sending messages to your employer, interfering with your work accounts, making you miss meetings, or damaging your professional reputation.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your employer receives messages or information about you from the other person
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They contact your workplace to cause problems.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Work accounts are interfered with
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You miss meetings, deadlines, or communications due to sabotage.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your professional reputation is being damaged online
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: LinkedIn, professional directories, or industry forums are targeted.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Tell your employer what's happening
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Many workplaces have policies for supporting employees experiencing domestic violence.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Secure your work accounts independently
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Change passwords and enable 2FA on all work-related accounts.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Document the sabotage
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Keep records of every interference for HR and potentially for legal action.

objects.name: Subscription/Service Cancellation
objects.description: Cancelling victim's essential services including phone plans, internet service, insurance, utility accounts, or subscriptions without consent. Disrupts victim's daily life, communication ability, and access to essential services. May be timed to cause maximum impact such as during extreme weather or when victim is isolated.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone cancels your subscriptions, services, or utilities — phone plan, internet, streaming, insurance, or other services you depend on — to disrupt your life and assert control.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Services stop working unexpectedly
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Your phone, internet, or other services are disconnected.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You receive cancellation confirmations you didn't request
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Services you rely on have been cancelled.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person has account access to services in your name
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They can make changes because they know the login details.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact service providers to secure your accounts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Add passwords or PINs that only you know.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Set up essential services in your own name with your own credentials
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Independent accounts can't be cancelled by someone else.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Document cancelled services and the impact
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This evidence may be relevant for legal proceedings.

objects.name: Location-Based Assault
objects.description: Using GPS tracking, location sharing, or other surveillance techniques to determine victim's real-time location and then physically approaching or assaulting them. Technology enables perpetrator to find victim at any location, negating traditional safety measures like staying with friends or varying routines.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Correlation of tracking data with assault location
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_title: Using Your Location to Find and Harm You
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses tracking technology to locate you and then physically approaches, confronts, or assaults you. Technology enables the physical harm by revealing where you are.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you are in immediate danger, call 000. If you suspect someone is tracking your location to find you, contact police and a support service for safety planning.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person shows up at places you haven't told them about
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They appear at locations that should be unknown to them.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Confrontations happen at locations you only visited once
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They're tracking your movements in real time.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Review all tracking and location sharing immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Check your phone, car, and belongings for trackers. Review all app permissions.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Create a safety plan with a support service
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: 1800RESPECT and local DV services can help you plan for physical safety.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to police
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Location-based stalking and assault are serious crimes.

objects.name: Safe Location Disclosure
objects.description: Revealing the location of victim's shelter, safe house, refuge, or hidden address to the perpetrator or others. May involve sharing information publicly, telling mutual contacts, or using technology to discover and disclose the protected location, directly endangering victim's physical safety.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Social media posts with location data
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone discovers and reveals the address of your refuge, shelter, safe house, or new home — putting you and potentially others at risk.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If your safe location has been compromised, contact the service managing your safety immediately. You may need to relocate.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person references or appears near your safe location
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They know where you're staying despite it being confidential.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You receive communications indicating your address is known
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Messages referencing your current location.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your support service or refuge immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They can help assess the risk and arrange relocation if needed.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact police if there's an immediate safety threat
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Call 000 if you're in danger.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Review how the location may have been discovered
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Check devices for tracking, review social media for location clues, and consider whether anyone might have shared the information.

objects.name: Movement Interception
objects.description: Using location tracking data to intercept victim during travel, at appointments, or at known destinations. Perpetrator uses real-time or predicted location information to position themselves along victim's route or at their destination. Creates a sense of inescapable surveillance and control.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Tracking data correlating with interception events
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses technology to predict or track your travel routes and intercepts you — appearing on your commute, following your car, or confronting you during transit.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If someone is intercepting your movements, vary your routes and times. Contact police.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person appears on your commute or regular routes
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They show up along paths they shouldn't know about.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Your travel patterns seem to be predicted
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They know when you leave and which route you take.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Vary your routes and times
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Don't follow the same pattern every day.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check your vehicle for GPS trackers
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Inspect thoroughly, including underneath.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to police
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This constitutes stalking.

objects.name: Smart Lock Manipulation
objects.description: Remotely locking victim inside or outside of their residence, changing access codes, or manipulating smart lock systems to control victim's physical movement and access to shelter. May also include granting access to others or monitoring entry/exit patterns.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses smart lock access to lock you in or out of your home, change access codes, or create an unsafe environment — especially after separation when they retain admin access.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If you are locked in your home and feel unsafe, call 000.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Smart lock codes stop working or change without your input
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: You can't get in or out of your home.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person lets themselves in after you've changed physical locks
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They still have smart lock access.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Lock activity logs show access at times the other person shouldn't be entering
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The smart lock records show unauthorised entries.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Factory reset smart locks and set up new codes
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Remove all previous users and start fresh.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Consider replacing smart locks with traditional deadbolts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Physical locks can't be controlled remotely.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact a locksmith who understands smart home security
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: They can ensure your home is properly secured.

objects.name: Vehicle Sabotage
objects.description: Remotely disabling, manipulating, or monitoring victim's connected vehicle. Modern connected cars may be remotely controlled through manufacturer apps, including locking/unlocking, starting/stopping engine, tracking location, and in some cases controlling speed or braking. May also include disabling vehicle through telematics systems.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses technology to interfere with your vehicle — disabling features through connected car apps, tracking via built-in GPS, or sabotaging vehicle systems.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Vehicle sabotage is dangerous. If you suspect interference with your car, have it inspected by a mechanic before driving.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Vehicle features stop working or behave strangely
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Remote start, locking, or other connected features malfunction.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person uses a connected car app to track or control your vehicle
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They can see your location or disable features through the manufacturer's app.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact the vehicle manufacturer about removing the other person's app access
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Explain the situation and request sole account control.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Have the vehicle inspected by a mechanic
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Check for trackers and tampering.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Change the connected car account passwords
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Remove the other person's access to vehicle apps.

objects.name: IoT Device Weaponization
objects.description: Using smart home devices to create fear, disorientation, or physical discomfort. Includes randomly triggering alarms, playing sounds through speakers, turning lights on/off, changing temperature extremes, activating cameras, or other manipulations of the smart home environment designed to terrorize victim.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Victim testimony about unexplained device behavior
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses internet-connected devices to create fear, discomfort, or danger — playing sounds at night, extreme temperature changes, turning off security systems, or other disruptive actions.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If IoT devices are creating unsafe conditions, disconnect them. Your safety is more important than smart home convenience.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Devices activate at disturbing times
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Speakers play sounds at night, lights flash, or alarms trigger.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Heating or cooling goes to extremes
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Temperature is set dangerously high or low.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Security cameras or systems are disabled
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Your security devices stop working.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Unplug or disconnect concerning devices
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Remove the immediate threat.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Change your Wi-Fi password
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: This disconnects all smart devices.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Factory reset and reconfigure only essential devices
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Set them up on accounts only you control.

objects.name: Medical Device Interference
objects.description: Tampering with victim's connected medical devices, health monitoring equipment, or health data. May include altering medication reminder settings, manipulating health data to affect treatment decisions, disabling monitoring devices, or interfering with telehealth appointments. Creates direct physical health risks.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone interferes with technology-connected medical devices or health management systems — insulin pumps, medication reminders, CPAP machines, or other health-critical technology.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Interference with medical devices can be life-threatening. Contact your healthcare provider and police immediately.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Medical device settings have been changed
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Dosages, schedules, or configurations are different from what was prescribed.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Medication reminders or health apps have been altered
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Alarms are turned off, medications are removed from tracking apps, or prescriptions are cancelled.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact your healthcare provider immediately
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Report the interference and get your medical devices checked.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Secure access to medical device apps and accounts
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Change passwords and remove the other person's access.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report to police
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Interfering with medical devices is a serious criminal offence.

objects.name: Stalking Coordination
objects.description: Using technology to plan, coordinate, and execute physical stalking of victim. Includes using location data to track patterns, mapping victim's routine, coordinating with others to maintain surveillance, and using digital tools to avoid detection. Technology amplifies traditional stalking by providing real-time intelligence.

x_tfa_evidence_types: Correlation of digital surveillance with physical presence
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses multiple technology methods together to stalk you — combining phone tracking, social media monitoring, third-party informants, and physical surveillance into a persistent pattern.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Coordinated stalking is dangerous and often escalates. Contact police and a specialist stalking support service.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person knows your movements with impossible precision
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: They know where you are at all times, suggesting multiple tracking methods.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: You feel watched from multiple directions
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The surveillance feels comprehensive and persistent.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Others seem to be involved in tracking you
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Third parties appear to be reporting your movements.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Contact police and report the full pattern
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Present the complete picture, not just individual incidents.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Work with a specialist service to do a full technology safety audit
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Check all devices, accounts, vehicles, and belongings.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Create a comprehensive safety plan
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: A specialist service can help plan for your physical and digital safety together.

objects.name: Emergency Service Manipulation
objects.description: Filing false police reports, fabricating evidence for protective orders, making false welfare check requests, or otherwise weaponizing emergency and legal services against victim. Uses digital tools to create false evidence, coordinate false reports, or manipulate authorities into taking action against victim.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone makes false reports to police, child protection, or other authorities about you — sending emergency services to your home, triggering investigations, or creating a record of false complaints.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: If authorities arrive based on false reports, stay calm and cooperate. Document the false report for your own records and tell your lawyer.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Authorities arrive based on reports you didn't make
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Police, child protection, or other services respond to calls that didn't come from you.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: A pattern of false reports emerges
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Repeated false complaints to authorities.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Proactively brief local police about the false reporting risk
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Ask for your address to be flagged.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Report false emergency calls as criminal offences
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Gather evidence that reports are fabricated.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Keep a chronological record of all false reports
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Dates, responding agencies, and outcomes.

objects.name: Child Custody Tech Abuse
objects.description: Using location sharing requirements, court-ordered communication apps, parenting coordination platforms, or children's devices to extend surveillance, control, and abuse beyond separation. Exploits legitimate co-parenting technology to maintain perpetrator's access to and control over victim's life through the children.

extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_summary: Someone uses custody arrangements as a channel for technology-facilitated abuse — monitoring through children's devices, using co-parenting apps for harassment, or leveraging custody exchanges for surveillance.
extension-definition--acf2f380-0000-4000.x_tfa_public_safety_warning: Children's safety is paramount. Document all technology misuse through custody arrangements for family court.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: The other person tracks children's locations excessively
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Constant location checking beyond what's needed for custody.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Co-parenting apps are used for hostile messages instead of co-parenting
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: The communication platform becomes a harassment tool.

x_tfa_public_notices.signal: Children's devices have monitoring software that enables household surveillance
x_tfa_public_notices.detail: Apps on children's phones that track your location or record your home.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Use court-approved co-parenting apps
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Apps like OurFamilyWizard create documented, structured communication.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Check children's devices for monitoring software
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Audit apps and permissions on devices the children bring between homes.

x_tfa_public_actions.action: Document all technology misuse for family court
x_tfa_public_actions.detail: Courts take technology-facilitated abuse seriously in custody decisions.
