objects.name: Anti-Stalkerware Scanning
objects.description: Deploy anti-stalkerware detection tools to identify monitoring applications. Scan for apps with excessive permissions including location, microphone, camera, and message access.

objects.name: Device Access Controls
objects.description: Implement strong device authentication. Disable installation from unknown sources. Maintain physical control of devices.

objects.name: Safe Device Acquisition
objects.description: Obtain a separate device for sensitive communications if stalkerware is suspected. Removing stalkerware may alert the monitoring party.

objects.name: Operating System Hardening
objects.description: Maintain current OS versions. Security updates frequently patch vulnerabilities exploited by stalkerware.

objects.name: Forensic Device Audit
objects.description: Engage professional forensic analysis to identify monitoring software and preserve evidence.

objects.name: Bluetooth Tracker Detection
objects.description: Use tracker detection applications to scan for nearby Bluetooth tracking devices. Enable platform-native unknown tracker alerts.

objects.name: Physical Vehicle Inspection
objects.description: Conduct systematic inspection of vehicles for GPS tracking devices in common concealment locations.

objects.name: Belongings Audit
objects.description: Inspect bags, clothing, and frequently carried items for concealed tracking devices.

objects.name: Evidence Preservation Protocol
objects.description: If tracker discovered, document location and preserve for evidence before removal. Removal alerts monitoring party.

objects.name: Location Sharing Audit
objects.description: Review all location sharing configurations across devices and services. Disable unauthorised sharing.

objects.name: Account Separation
objects.description: Migrate to individual accounts for services previously shared. Use new credentials unknown to adversary.

objects.name: Carrier Account Review
objects.description: Assess family phone plan features that expose location or usage data. Plan migration to individual account.

objects.name: Privacy Configuration Hardening
objects.description: Configure maximum privacy settings on all social media platforms. Restrict visibility of posts, connections, and activity.

objects.name: Connection Audit
objects.description: Review all followers and connections for adversary-controlled accounts. Remove suspicious connections.

objects.name: Information Disclosure Controls
objects.description: Avoid posting real-time locations, routines, or future plans. Delay posting until after events conclude.

objects.name: Tag and Mention Restrictions
objects.description: Disable or require approval for tags and mentions to prevent third-party location disclosure.

objects.name: Email Rule Audit
objects.description: Check email settings for unauthorised forwarding rules and filters. Remove rules forwarding to unknown addresses.

objects.name: Linked Device Review
objects.description: Review and remove unrecognised devices linked to messaging accounts.

objects.name: Encrypted Communications
objects.description: Use end-to-end encrypted messaging for sensitive communications. Ensure adversary cannot access linked devices.

objects.name: Voicemail Security
objects.description: Change voicemail PIN. Disable remote voicemail access where possible.

objects.name: Smart Home Account Takeover
objects.description: Transfer device ownership to sole-controlled account. Factory reset devices and reconfigure with new credentials.

objects.name: Recording Device Audit
objects.description: Identify all cameras, microphones, and recording-capable devices. Disable or remove devices that cannot be secured.

objects.name: Voice Assistant Hardening
objects.description: Disable remote access features, drop-in capabilities, and voice purchasing. Delete stored recordings.

objects.name: Router Credential Reset
objects.description: Change router admin credentials. Factory reset router if adversary configured it.

objects.name: Traffic Encryption
objects.description: Use VPN to encrypt internet traffic and prevent network-level monitoring.

objects.name: Network Bypass
objects.description: Use mobile data instead of home network for sensitive browsing.

objects.name: Calendar Sharing Audit
objects.description: Review and remove unauthorised calendar sharing permissions across all calendar applications.

objects.name: Sensitive Appointment Isolation
objects.description: Use separate calendar on adversary-unknown account for sensitive appointments.

objects.name: Medical Portal Security
objects.description: Change credentials on health portals. Remove adversary as authorised contact.

objects.name: Information Compartmentalisation
objects.description: Limit sensitive information shared with contacts who maintain relationship with adversary.

objects.name: Network Trust Assessment
objects.description: Identify which contacts may relay information to adversary based on information leakage patterns.

objects.name: Canary Information Testing
objects.description: Share unique details with specific contacts to identify information relay sources.

objects.name: Health Account Separation
objects.description: Unlink health and fitness accounts from shared or adversary-known accounts. Create new accounts with private credentials.

objects.name: Fitness App Privacy Settings
objects.description: Disable public profiles, activity sharing, and social features on fitness platforms.

objects.name: Wearable Device Reset
objects.description: Factory reset wearable devices and configure with sole-controlled account.

objects.name: Password Manager Deployment
objects.description: Use password manager with strong master password. Generate unique passwords for all accounts.

objects.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
objects.description: Enable MFA on all accounts using authenticator app on secure device.

objects.name: Credential Entry Security
objects.description: Use privacy screens. Avoid password entry where adversary can observe.

objects.name: Post-Separation Credential Reset
objects.description: Change all passwords after separation, starting with email accounts.

objects.name: Account Documentation
objects.description: Document all account details including usernames, associated contacts, and creation dates for recovery purposes.

objects.name: Recovery Contact Security
objects.description: Change recovery email and phone to adversary-unknown contacts.

objects.name: Platform Recovery Engagement
objects.description: Contact platform support for account recovery. Many platforms have DFV-specific recovery processes.

objects.name: Multiple Recovery Methods
objects.description: Configure multiple recovery options so compromise of one does not eliminate account access.

objects.name: Security Question Hardening
objects.description: Use fictitious answers to security questions that adversary cannot guess from personal knowledge.

objects.name: Recovery Email Security
objects.description: Secure recovery email account with strong unique credentials and MFA.

objects.name: Active Session Monitoring
objects.description: Regularly review active sessions on all accounts. Terminate unrecognised sessions.

objects.name: Session Termination
objects.description: Use 'sign out all sessions' feature after credential changes.

objects.name: Remote Management Removal
objects.description: Remove device from adversary's Find My/Find My Device account.

objects.name: Account Migration
objects.description: Migrate device to sole-controlled Apple ID or Google account. Factory reset if required.

objects.name: Authenticator App Security
objects.description: Use authenticator app on secure device rather than SMS-based 2FA.

objects.name: SIM Security Controls
objects.description: Contact carrier to add SIM lock PIN and port-out protection.

objects.name: Hardware Security Key
objects.description: Use hardware security key for highest-risk accounts.

objects.name: Cloud Account Security
objects.description: Change passwords and enable MFA on cloud storage. Review and remove sharing permissions.

objects.name: Backup Encryption
objects.description: Enable encrypted backups where available.

objects.name: Shared Account Separation
objects.description: Systematically separate shared accounts for streaming, utilities, and subscriptions.

objects.name: Shared Account Documentation
objects.description: Document all shared account details before separation.

objects.name: Data Backup Protocol
objects.description: Maintain regular backups to adversary-inaccessible storage.

objects.name: Physical Device Security
objects.description: Maintain physical control of devices. Store evidence in secure cloud storage.

objects.name: Administrative Control Removal
objects.description: Remove parental control software and MDM profiles. Factory reset if removal not possible.

objects.name: Family Group Exit
objects.description: Leave family sharing groups that grant adversary administrative control.

objects.name: Evidence Preservation
objects.description: Screenshot and save all threatening messages with timestamps and sender details.

objects.name: Platform and Law Enforcement Reporting
objects.description: Report threats to platform and police. Preserve evidence for legal proceedings.

objects.name: Communication Boundary Enforcement
objects.description: Establish communication boundaries. Block on platforms where no legitimate contact required.

objects.name: Contact Documentation
objects.description: Maintain log of all unwanted contact with dates, times, platforms, and content.

objects.name: Block and Filter Strategy
objects.description: Block adversary on all platforms. Configure email filters to archive messages for evidence.

objects.name: Carrier Harassment Report
objects.description: Contact phone carrier to report harassment and implement call blocking.

objects.name: Multi-Platform Block Maintenance
objects.description: Maintain blocks across platforms. Enable unknown sender filtering.

objects.name: Ban Evasion Reporting
objects.description: Report new accounts to platforms for ban evasion.

objects.name: Mass Block and Report
objects.description: Block and report all participating accounts. Report coordinated harassment pattern to platform.

objects.name: Temporary Account Restriction
objects.description: Temporarily restrict account access and disable comments during active campaign.

objects.name: Regulatory Body Report
objects.description: Report serious coordinated harassment to eSafety Commissioner or equivalent body.

objects.name: Personal Information Minimisation
objects.description: Audit and remove personal information from public sources. Opt out of data broker sites.

objects.name: Address and Contact Protection
objects.description: Use PO Box for mail. Register domains with privacy protection.

objects.name: Doxxing Response Protocol
objects.description: If doxxed: report to police, request content removal, alert workplace, document everything.

objects.name: Law Enforcement Notification
objects.description: Notify local police of false report risk. Request address flagging in dispatch system.

objects.name: Emergency Response Preparation
objects.description: Prepare for calm interaction with emergency services. Brief household members.

objects.name: Content Backup
objects.description: Regularly backup social media content using platform export tools.

objects.name: Appeal Process Utilisation
objects.description: Appeal account restrictions with context about weaponised reporting pattern.

objects.name: Content Removal Request
objects.description: Report humiliating content to platform. Report to regulatory body for serious content.

objects.name: Search Result Management
objects.description: Request deindexing of harmful content. Create positive content to influence search results.

objects.name: Impersonation Reporting
objects.description: Report fake accounts to platform using impersonation reporting process.

objects.name: Network Notification
objects.description: Inform contacts of fake accounts and request verification through trusted channels.

objects.name: False Review Dispute
objects.description: Flag false reviews for removal. Provide evidence of fraudulent origin.

objects.name: Review Response Strategy
objects.description: Respond professionally to false reviews. Request genuine client reviews to counterbalance.

objects.name: Email Filtering
objects.description: Configure email filtering to manage volume. Unsubscribe from spam subscriptions.

objects.name: Communication Channel Protection
objects.description: Consider temporary contact change while maintaining bombarded accounts for evidence.

objects.name: AI Content Detection
objects.description: Use AI detection tools to identify synthetic content for evidence purposes.

objects.name: Platform-Level Reporting
objects.description: Report automated abuse patterns to platforms rather than responding to individual items.

objects.name: Original Record Preservation
objects.description: Preserve original communications using platform export tools with metadata.

objects.name: Metadata Verification
objects.description: Use platform records with headers and metadata rather than screenshots for evidence.

objects.name: Witness Communication
objects.description: Include trusted witness in important communications for corroboration.

objects.name: Digital State Documentation
objects.description: Screenshot settings and configurations to establish baseline. Log device states to detect changes.

objects.name: External Verification
objects.description: Verify noticed changes with trusted person before doubting own perception.

objects.name: Version History Monitoring
objects.description: Enable and check version history on shared documents to detect manipulation.

objects.name: Regulatory Body Report
objects.description: Report NCII to eSafety Commissioner or equivalent body with legal content removal powers.

objects.name: Hash-Based Prevention Registration
objects.description: Register images with StopNCII.org to prevent re-upload on participating platforms.

objects.name: Law Enforcement Report
objects.description: Report to police. NCII is criminal offence in most jurisdictions.

objects.name: Synthetic Content Reporting
objects.description: Report deepfake intimate content to regulatory body and police. Deepfakes treated equivalently to real NCII.

objects.name: Source Image Restriction
objects.description: Restrict access to facial photos on social media to limit deepfake source material.

objects.name: Counter-Narrative Development
objects.description: Develop response strategy with support services. Share truth selectively with key contacts.

objects.name: False Claim Documentation
objects.description: Document each false claim with evidence contradicting it for legal proceedings.

objects.name: Full Context Preservation
objects.description: Preserve complete communication threads and surrounding context.

objects.name: Written Communication Preference
objects.description: Conduct important discussions in writing on platforms maintaining complete records.

objects.name: Non-Compliance
objects.description: Do not comply with demands. Compliance typically leads to escalating demands.

objects.name: Specialist Support Engagement
objects.description: Contact regulatory body and law enforcement sextortion support resources.

objects.name: Identity Verification
objects.description: Verify online relationship identity through video calls and reverse image search before trust development.

objects.name: Financial Boundary Enforcement
objects.description: Never send money or financial information to online-only contacts.

objects.name: Search Result Monitoring
objects.description: Set up alerts for own name. Regular self-search to identify harmful content early.

objects.name: Positive Content Creation
objects.description: Create professional content under own name to influence search results.

objects.name: Legal Content Removal
objects.description: Seek legal advice about defamation action or court-ordered content removal.

objects.name: Historical Content Cleanup
objects.description: Review and restrict visibility of old content that could be weaponised.

objects.name: Context Preparation
objects.description: Prepare contextual explanations for known historical content with support team.

objects.name: Digital Forensic Engagement
objects.description: Engage forensic specialist to analyse suspected fabricated evidence and provide expert testimony.

objects.name: Platform Record Requests
objects.description: Request official platform records for critical communications. Harder to fabricate than screenshots.

objects.name: Secure Communication Channel
objects.description: Use separate secure device for sensitive communications with support services.

objects.name: Message Verification
objects.description: Verify directly with contacts if relationships deteriorate unexpectedly.

objects.name: Contact and Filter Audit
objects.description: Periodically check blocked contacts and email filter rules for unauthorised changes.

objects.name: Alternative Contact Methods
objects.description: Maintain backup contact methods for key support people.

objects.name: Autonomy Assertion
objects.description: Recognise demands to control social media connections as controlling behaviour. Document demands.

objects.name: Private Secondary Account
objects.description: Maintain separate private account for support connections if needed.

objects.name: Parental Control Removal
objects.description: Remove parental controls from adult devices. Factory reset if removal not possible.

objects.name: Secondary Device Access
objects.description: Maintain access to secondary device adversary cannot control.

objects.name: Support Network Communication
objects.description: Proactively inform key contacts about adversary's potential false information campaign.

objects.name: Professional Support Briefing
objects.description: Ensure professionals (therapist, lawyer, caseworker) are aware adversary may contact them.

objects.name: Ban Appeal with Context
objects.description: Appeal bans with context about coordinated reporting campaign.

objects.name: Support Network Diversification
objects.description: Maintain connections across multiple platforms and in-person support.

objects.name: Monitoring Assumption Planning
objects.description: Use separate safe device for sensitive communications if monitoring disclosed.

objects.name: Monitoring Capability Verification
objects.description: Have professional assess actual monitoring capability to calibrate response.

objects.name: Alternative Resource Access
objects.description: Memorise key helpline numbers. Use mobile data or public computers to access blocked resources.

objects.name: Network Blocking Bypass
objects.description: Use mobile data, change DNS settings, or use VPN to bypass network-level blocking.

objects.name: Document Duplication
objects.description: Obtain copies of critical identity documents. Store in adversary-inaccessible location.

objects.name: Government Portal Security
objects.description: Secure access to government portals under sole-controlled credentials.

objects.name: Forwarding Rule Audit
objects.description: Check email settings for unauthorised forwarding rules and filters.

objects.name: Call Forwarding Check
objects.description: Check phone settings and carrier account for call forwarding configurations.

objects.name: Financial Account Security Reset
objects.description: Change passwords, enable MFA, remove adversary as authorised user on individual accounts.

objects.name: Financial Counselling
objects.description: Contact financial counsellor experienced in DFV situations for guidance.

objects.name: Emergency Financial Access
objects.description: Maintain separate emergency fund in adversary-unknown account.

objects.name: Separate Transaction Account
objects.description: Open individual account at different institution for sensitive transactions.

objects.name: Untraceable Payment Methods
objects.description: Use cash or prepaid cards for purchases to keep private.

objects.name: Independent Financial Access
objects.description: Establish independent financial access: personal account, credit card, superannuation access.

objects.name: Legal Financial Advice
objects.description: Consult lawyer about financial rights and emergency relief options.

objects.name: Transaction Alert Configuration
objects.description: Enable real-time transaction alerts on all financial accounts.

objects.name: Fraud Reporting
objects.description: Report unauthorised transactions to financial institution and police.

objects.name: Coerced Debt Legal Advice
objects.description: Consult about coerced debt pathways. Debts incurred under duress may be dischargeable.

objects.name: Coercion Documentation
objects.description: Document coercion circumstances for legal proceedings.

objects.name: Investment Verification
objects.description: Verify investment opportunities independently through regulatory body resources.

objects.name: Fraud Reporting
objects.description: Report suspected investment fraud to consumer protection and cyber security agencies.

objects.name: Payment Destination Security
objects.description: Ensure all payments directed to sole-controlled account. Update payment details with agencies and employers.

objects.name: Mail Redirection Check
objects.description: Verify no mail redirection configured without knowledge.

objects.name: Credit Monitoring
objects.description: Set up credit monitoring. Request credit reports from all reporting bodies.

objects.name: Credit Ban
objects.description: Place credit ban to prevent new applications. Available free for DFV victims.

objects.name: Identity Theft Report
objects.description: Report identity theft to national identity support service.

objects.name: Smart Home Account Control
objects.description: Transfer all smart home device accounts to sole control. Factory reset and reconfigure.

objects.name: Manual Override Capability
objects.description: Ensure manual overrides available for all smart home-controlled utilities.

objects.name: Employer Notification
objects.description: Inform employer about potential for adversary workplace contact if safe to do so.

objects.name: Professional Account Security
objects.description: Secure professional accounts with strong credentials and MFA.

objects.name: Individual Account Registration
objects.description: Register essential services under own name and billing.

objects.name: Service Provider DFV Support
objects.description: Request DFV support pathway from service providers for expedited account changes.

objects.name: Comprehensive Location Security
objects.description: Disable all location sharing, remove trackers, secure location-revealing accounts, vary routines.

objects.name: Safety Planning
objects.description: Develop comprehensive safety plan with support service addressing technology-enabled tracking.

objects.name: Law Enforcement Report
objects.description: Report stalking and tracking to police. Apply for intervention order with technology-specific conditions.

objects.name: Safe Location Digital Hygiene
objects.description: Disable location services. Strip metadata from images. Avoid tagging safe location digitally.

objects.name: Secure Communication from Safe Location
objects.description: Use new device and accounts. Only communicate location to those who must know via secure channels.

objects.name: Route Variation
objects.description: Vary routes, departure times, and transport methods.

objects.name: Appointment Security
objects.description: Keep appointments off monitored calendars. Arrange support person accompaniment.

objects.name: Smart Lock Security Reset
objects.description: Change all smart lock credentials. Remove adversary access. Replace with traditional locks if needed.

objects.name: Lock Replacement Post-Separation
objects.description: Change all locks after separation. Most jurisdictions require landlords to do this for DFV situations.

objects.name: Connected Car Account Security
objects.description: Change connected car credentials. Remove adversary from vehicle account access.

objects.name: Vehicle Safety Inspection
objects.description: Have mechanic inspect for tracking devices and tampering. Check OBD-II port.

objects.name: IoT Device Audit and Reset
objects.description: Audit all smart home devices. Factory reset and reconfigure under sole-controlled account.

objects.name: Network Security
objects.description: Change Wi-Fi passwords. Remove adversary access to router admin.

objects.name: Medical Device Security Review
objects.description: Inform healthcare provider of DFV situation. Request security review of connected medical devices.

objects.name: Health Record Access Control
objects.description: Restrict health record access. Change patient portal credentials. Remove adversary as authorised contact.

objects.name: Anti-Stalking Strategy
objects.description: Develop comprehensive anti-stalking safety plan with police and support service.

objects.name: Stalking Evidence Documentation
objects.description: Maintain detailed stalking log documenting every incident. Use stalking documentation tools.

objects.name: Law Enforcement False Report Briefing
objects.description: Inform police of false report risk. Request address flagging.

objects.name: False Report Legal Response
objects.description: Report false emergency calls as criminal offences. Gather evidence reports are fabricated.

objects.name: Co-Parenting App Boundaries
objects.description: Use court-approved co-parenting apps for documented communication.

objects.name: Children's Device Security
objects.description: Audit children's devices for monitoring. Manage parental controls.

objects.name: Legal Tech Abuse Documentation
objects.description: Document technology abuse through custody arrangements for family court.

objects.name: Anomalous Battery Consumption
objects.description: Device battery depletes faster than baseline due to continuous background data transmission.

objects.name: Unexplained Data Usage
objects.description: Increased mobile data consumption without corresponding user activity. Monitor per-app data usage for unknown processes.

objects.name: Device Temperature Anomalies
objects.description: Device runs hot during idle periods indicating background process activity.

objects.name: Information Leakage Indicators
objects.description: Adversary demonstrates knowledge of private communications, locations, or activities accessible only through device monitoring.

objects.name: Unknown Applications or Profiles
objects.description: Presence of unrecognised apps, device administrator privileges, or configuration profiles.

objects.name: Platform Tracker Alerts
objects.description: Device displays alerts for unknown tracking devices travelling with user.

objects.name: Location Knowledge Indicators
objects.description: Adversary references specific locations, routes, or timing not disclosed by target.

objects.name: Physical Device Discovery
objects.description: Small electronic device found attached to vehicle or concealed in belongings.

objects.name: Audible Tracker Indicators
objects.description: Periodic beeping from unknown source in belongings or vehicle.

objects.name: Shared Account Data References
objects.description: Adversary references location, purchases, or activities visible through shared account access.

objects.name: Active Location Sharing Discovery
objects.description: Audit reveals location sharing enabled with adversary's account.

objects.name: Unknown Devices on Shared Accounts
objects.description: Unrecognised devices listed in shared account trusted device lists.

objects.name: Non-Public Activity Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary references social media activity that should not be visible given current privacy settings.

objects.name: Suspicious Account Patterns
objects.description: New follower accounts created recently with minimal activity or connections to adversary's network.

objects.name: Third-Party Monitoring Reports
objects.description: Contacts report adversary has shown them target's social media content or asked about online activity.

objects.name: Read Receipt Anomalies
objects.description: Messages marked as read before target has viewed them. Account shows online status during non-use periods.

objects.name: Unauthorised Forwarding Rules
objects.description: Email settings contain forwarding rules to unknown addresses or filters moving messages automatically.

objects.name: Unknown Linked Devices
objects.description: Messaging app settings show unrecognised devices with active sessions.

objects.name: Communication Content Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary quotes or references private message content.

objects.name: In-Home Activity Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary references conversations or activities that occurred inside the home.

objects.name: Device Behaviour Anomalies
objects.description: Cameras activating, indicator lights engaging, or voice assistants responding without user trigger.

objects.name: Unauthorised Device Access
objects.description: Smart home app settings show adversary account retains admin or viewer access.

objects.name: Browsing Activity Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary references websites visited or searches performed.

objects.name: Unauthorised Network Controls
objects.description: Router contains parental controls, content filtering, or logging not configured by target.

objects.name: Network Monitoring Tools Present
objects.description: Discovery of network monitoring software or devices on home network.

objects.name: Appointment Interception
objects.description: Adversary appears at calendar events they should not know about.

objects.name: Schedule Knowledge Indicators
objects.description: Adversary references upcoming appointments before disclosure.

objects.name: Active Calendar Sharing
objects.description: Audit reveals adversary retains calendar viewing access.

objects.name: Source-Specific Information Leakage
objects.description: Adversary gains knowledge of information shared only with specific individuals.

objects.name: Unusual Contact Questioning
objects.description: Contacts ask unusually specific questions about location, plans, or relationships.

objects.name: Recruitment Attempt Reports
objects.description: Trusted contacts report adversary has requested information about target.

objects.name: Health Data Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary references exercise patterns, sleep data, health metrics, or location data from fitness tracking.

objects.name: Active Health Data Sharing
objects.description: Audit reveals fitness or health apps sharing data with adversary's account.

objects.name: Wearable Account Linkage
objects.description: Fitness tracker connected to adversary-controlled account.

objects.name: Unauthorised Access Alerts
objects.description: Login notifications from unrecognised devices or locations.

objects.name: Account Lockout Events
objects.description: Unable to access accounts with previously valid credentials.

objects.name: Account Content Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary demonstrates knowledge of account-specific content.

objects.name: Complete Account Lockout
objects.description: Unable to access accounts. Password reset attempts fail or redirect to unknown contacts.

objects.name: Unauthorised Profile Changes
objects.description: Contacts report changes to profile content not made by account owner.

objects.name: Recovery Option Modification
objects.description: Account recovery reveals changed backup contacts or security questions.

objects.name: Unrequested Password Change Notifications
objects.description: Receiving confirmation of password or security changes not initiated by account owner.

objects.name: Recovery Method Change Alerts
objects.description: Notifications of backup email, phone, or security question changes.

objects.name: Unknown Active Sessions
objects.description: Session review shows sign-ins from unrecognised devices or locations.

objects.name: Unauthorised Account Activity
objects.description: Settings changed or content accessed without user action. Review platform activity logs.

objects.name: Remote Lock Activation
objects.description: Device displays lock screen or lost mode message without user action.

objects.name: Remote Wipe Execution
objects.description: Device factory resets without user initiation.

objects.name: SIM Swap Indicators
objects.description: Sudden loss of mobile service may indicate SIM swap attack.

objects.name: Unrequested 2FA Codes
objects.description: Receiving 2FA codes without initiating login attempts.

objects.name: Cloud Access Alerts
objects.description: Sign-in alerts for cloud services from unfamiliar devices or locations.

objects.name: Cloud Content Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary demonstrates knowledge of cloud-only content.

objects.name: Shared Service Disruption
objects.description: Shared services cancelled, passwords changed, or access revoked without discussion.

objects.name: Weaponized Account Activity
objects.description: Adversary uses shared account access to monitor activity or make changes as control mechanism.

objects.name: Unexplained Data Loss
objects.description: Files, photos, or messages disappearing without user action.

objects.name: Device Damage or Reset
objects.description: Devices physically damaged or factory reset during adversary access periods.

objects.name: Unexpected Device Restrictions
objects.description: Apps blocked, websites inaccessible, or features limited by parental controls not installed by user.

objects.name: Usage Reports to Adversary
objects.description: Screen Time or similar tools sending activity reports to adversary's account.

objects.name: Threatening Content Receipt
objects.description: Messages containing explicit or implicit threats of harm or adverse consequences.

objects.name: Escalation Pattern
objects.description: Message tone becoming increasingly aggressive or menacing over time.

objects.name: High Volume Contact
objects.description: Unreasonable number of contact attempts across channels.

objects.name: Multi-Platform Contact Pattern
objects.description: Simultaneous contact attempts across multiple platforms.

objects.name: New Accounts with Adversary Indicators
objects.description: New accounts using familiar language patterns or referencing personal details.

objects.name: Alternative Channel Contact
objects.description: Contact via channels not previously used after blocking on primary platforms.

objects.name: Hostile Interaction Spike
objects.description: Rapid increase in negative interactions from multiple accounts.

objects.name: Coordination Indicators
objects.description: Multiple accounts using similar language, talking points, or hashtags.

objects.name: Personal Information Published
objects.description: Private information appears on public platforms.

objects.name: Stranger Harassment Based on Published Details
objects.description: Contact from unknown individuals referencing doxxed information.

objects.name: Unexpected Emergency Response
objects.description: Emergency services arrive in response to unrequested call.

objects.name: False Report Pattern
objects.description: Multiple false reports correlating with relationship events.

objects.name: Unjustified Account Restrictions
objects.description: Content removed or account restricted for non-violating posts during conflict periods.

objects.name: Multiple Report Indicators
objects.description: Platform communications indicating multiple reports against account.

objects.name: Harmful Content Discovery
objects.description: Posts containing embarrassing or private content about target.

objects.name: Third-Party Content Alerts
objects.description: Contacts report encountering harmful content online.

objects.name: Contact Reports of Impersonation Messages
objects.description: Contacts report receiving messages from accounts impersonating target.

objects.name: Fake Account Discovery
objects.description: Profiles using target's name, photos, or information discovered.

objects.name: Fraudulent Review Pattern
objects.description: Negative reviews from non-genuine accounts correlating with conflict events.

objects.name: Professional Impact
objects.description: Decline in business correlating with review attack.

objects.name: Spam Volume Spike
objects.description: Dramatic increase in spam, subscriptions, or marketing messages.

objects.name: Unrequested Sign-Up Confirmations
objects.description: Confirmation emails from services never subscribed to.

objects.name: Synthetic Language Patterns
objects.description: Messages that are formulaic, vary slightly while making same points, or arrive at unrealistic volumes.

objects.name: AI-Generated Media Indicators
objects.description: Media with artifacts characteristic of synthetic generation.

objects.name: Evidence Discrepancies
objects.description: Adversary-presented records don't match target's records of same communication.

objects.name: Message Alteration
objects.description: Messages deleted or content changed from what target recalls.

objects.name: Unexplained Setting Changes
objects.description: Device settings or file locations changed without user action. Check modification timestamps.

objects.name: Reality Questioning Pattern
objects.description: Increasing self-doubt about digital actions aligning with adversary's claims.

objects.name: Intimate Image Distribution Discovery
objects.description: Intimate images found on public platforms or reported by contacts.

objects.name: Distribution Threats
objects.description: Adversary threatens to share intimate images as leverage.

objects.name: Synthetic Content Discovery
objects.description: Intimate content surfaces that depicts events that never occurred. May show AI artifacts on close inspection.

objects.name: Fabricated Content Threats
objects.description: Adversary threatens distribution of content depicting situations that never happened.

objects.name: Unexplained Relationship Changes
objects.description: Contacts becoming distant without clear reason based on adversary communications.

objects.name: False Information Reports
objects.description: Trusted individuals report false information being shared by adversary.

objects.name: Decontextualised Content Sharing
objects.description: Adversary shares real but misleading content stripped of surrounding context.

objects.name: Partial Truth Accusations
objects.description: Third parties confront target about statements that are technically real but misleading without context.

objects.name: Extortion Demands
objects.description: Messages demanding money or compliance in exchange for not distributing intimate content.

objects.name: Demand Escalation
objects.description: Increased demands following initial compliance.

objects.name: Verification Avoidance
objects.description: Person consistently avoids video calls or in-person meetings. Photos may belong to someone else.

objects.name: Financial Request Escalation
objects.description: Increasingly urgent requests for financial assistance with compelling stories.

objects.name: Harmful Search Results
objects.description: Name search reveals websites containing false or harmful content designed to rank highly.

objects.name: Malicious Domain Registrations
objects.description: Websites registered using target's name containing harmful content.

objects.name: Old Content Resurfacing
objects.description: Historical content shared in new contexts timed to important events.

objects.name: Content Archiving Activity
objects.description: Evidence adversary systematically archiving target's historical content.

objects.name: Evidence Inconsistent with Records
objects.description: Presented evidence doesn't match target's records or memory of events.

objects.name: Metadata Inconsistencies
objects.description: Digital evidence contains impossible timestamps, missing metadata, or editing artifacts.

objects.name: Unauthorised Message Sending
objects.description: Contacts report receiving messages from target's accounts not sent by target.

objects.name: Unexplained Relationship Deterioration
objects.description: Support relationships deteriorate without clear cause.

objects.name: Missing Inbound Communications
objects.description: Contacts report sending messages that were never received.

objects.name: Unauthorised Blocked Contacts
objects.description: Contacts on blocked list that user did not block.

objects.name: Connection Control Demands
objects.description: Demands to unfriend specific people, restrict posting, or delete accounts.

objects.name: Connection Monitoring
objects.description: Adversary comments on or confronts about social media connections and interactions.

objects.name: External Device Restrictions
objects.description: Device has time limits, app restrictions, or content filters not configured by user.

objects.name: Resource Access Blocking
objects.description: Support websites, apps, or communication tools blocked at device or network level.

objects.name: Contact Attitude Changes
objects.description: Contacts suddenly withdrawing support or becoming hostile based on adversary communications.

objects.name: Adversary Contact Reports
objects.description: Support people report adversary has contacted them.

objects.name: Unexplained Community Removal
objects.description: Banned from communities without clear policy violation.

objects.name: Coordinated Reporting Evidence
objects.description: Community administrators report multiple reports received in short timeframe.

objects.name: Explicit Monitoring Claims
objects.description: Adversary states they can monitor communications, either as threat or demonstrated through knowledge.

objects.name: Self-Censorship Behaviour
objects.description: Target stops seeking help or being honest in communications due to monitoring fear.

objects.name: Support Website Inaccessibility
objects.description: Support resources inaccessible on home network but work on mobile data.

objects.name: Support Contact Removal
objects.description: Helpline numbers or support bookmarks removed from devices without user action.

objects.name: Document Access Denial
objects.description: Cannot access digital identity documents due to adversary-controlled storage.

objects.name: Document Relocation
objects.description: Digital documents moved, deleted, or password-protected without user action.

objects.name: Missing Expected Communications
objects.description: Emails, messages, or calls that senders confirm were sent but never received.

objects.name: Forwarding Discovery
objects.description: Audit reveals email forwarding or call forwarding to unknown destinations.

objects.name: Financial Account Lockout
objects.description: Unable to access financial accounts using previously valid credentials.

objects.name: Authorised User Removal
objects.description: Notification of removal from shared financial accounts.

objects.name: Transaction Knowledge
objects.description: Adversary references specific purchases, amounts, or merchants from bank transactions.

objects.name: Unauthorised Alert Configuration
objects.description: Transaction alerts configured to adversary's contact information.

objects.name: Unexplained Transaction Declines
objects.description: Card declined despite available funds, or daily limits reduced without consent.

objects.name: Spending Approval Requirements
objects.description: Spending limits or approval requirements enabled without user action.

objects.name: Unrecognised Transactions
objects.description: Transactions appearing on accounts not authorised by account holder.

objects.name: Balance Discrepancies
objects.description: Account balances lower than expected or funds moved without knowledge.

objects.name: Financial Coercion
objects.description: Threats, intimidation, or manipulation to make transactions or take on debt.

objects.name: Duress Debt Accumulation
objects.description: Increasing debt from pressured financial decisions.

objects.name: Pressure to Invest in Unverified Platforms
objects.description: Urged to invest on unfamiliar platforms that cannot be independently verified.

objects.name: Withdrawal Inability
objects.description: Invested funds cannot be withdrawn from platform.

objects.name: Missing Expected Payments
objects.description: Government benefits, salary, or other payments not arriving in expected accounts.

objects.name: Payment Detail Changes
objects.description: Direct deposit information changed without authorisation.

objects.name: Unknown Credit Activity
objects.description: Credit report shows accounts or enquiries not initiated by owner.

objects.name: Unknown Service Bills
objects.description: Bills or collection notices for services never subscribed to.

objects.name: Remote Utility Control
objects.description: Heating, cooling, lighting, or locks changing without user action.

objects.name: Manipulation-Reflective Utility Bills
objects.description: Unusual utility bills resulting from remote environmental manipulation.

objects.name: Workplace Interference
objects.description: Employer or colleagues report contact from adversary about target.

objects.name: Application Interference
objects.description: Job applications unsuccessful potentially due to adversary contact with prospective employers.

objects.name: Essential Service Cancellation
objects.description: Phone, internet, insurance, or utilities cancelled without knowledge or consent.

objects.name: Unauthorised Service Changes
objects.description: Service plans modified or features removed without notification.

objects.name: Location Interception
objects.description: Adversary appears at locations not disclosed to them.

objects.name: Location-Referencing Threats
objects.description: Threats that reference specific location or recent movements.

objects.name: Safe Location Discovery
objects.description: Adversary appears near or references safe location. Immediate safety emergency.

objects.name: Photo Metadata Exposure
objects.description: Shared photos contain GPS coordinates revealing safe location.

objects.name: Route Interception
objects.description: Adversary appearing along travel route or at destinations.

objects.name: Travel Knowledge Indicators
objects.description: Adversary demonstrates knowledge of travel plans before arrival.

objects.name: Lock Behaviour Anomalies
objects.description: Smart locks engaging or disengaging unexpectedly. Access codes no longer working.

objects.name: Physical Access Control
objects.description: Locked inside or outside home due to remote lock manipulation. Safety emergency.

objects.name: Remote Vehicle Control
objects.description: Vehicle functions activating without user action — horn, lights, locks, engine.

objects.name: Connected Car Access Alerts
objects.description: Notifications showing adversary's device accessing vehicle features.

objects.name: Unexplained Device Activation
objects.description: Smart home devices activating without user command — alarms, lights, speakers, TV.

objects.name: Environmental Manipulation
objects.description: Temperature or comfort settings changed remotely to create discomfort.

objects.name: Medical Device Setting Changes
objects.description: Connected medical device settings changed without user action. Contact healthcare provider immediately.

objects.name: Health Data Access Indicators
objects.description: Adversary demonstrates knowledge of health information they should not have access to.

objects.name: Repeated Unexplained Appearances
objects.description: Adversary repeatedly appears at different locations at varied times.

objects.name: Coordinated Surveillance Evidence
objects.description: Evidence adversary involved others in surveillance or uses multiple tracking methods.

objects.name: Unrequested Authority Visits
objects.description: Authorities arrive based on reports not made by target.

objects.name: False Report Pattern
objects.description: Learning false reports filed against target by adversary or associates.

objects.name: Excessive Location Monitoring
objects.description: Adversary checking children's location more than reasonably required.

objects.name: Co-Parenting App Misuse
objects.description: Co-parenting apps used for hostile messages rather than genuine co-parenting.

objects.name: Children's Device Surveillance
objects.description: Monitoring software on children's devices enabling household surveillance.
